title: Bug 21706BidiUtil in win32 has Class.forName() usage
description: Bug 21706BidiUtil in win32 has Class.forName() usage
OB: The BidiUtil class in the win32 platform uses the Class.forName() method.
EB: The BidiUtil class in the win32 platform should have a private constructor. Since there are no non-static methods in this class, making the constructor private will prevent unnecessary instantiation. The size of the class will not increase as the compiler provides a free public constructor by default.
SR:
To reproduce the issue, follow these steps:
1. Open the BidiUtil class in the win32 platform.
2. Look for the usage of Class.forName() method.
